requirement_tested: A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
user_persona: A hospital administrator named Sarah who needs real-time updates on hospital operations.
user_goal: To view the latest hospital metrics without seeing stale or hardcoded information.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing the Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the hospital management website to get an overview of current operations. She expects to see live data reflecting the hospital's status.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the homepage/dashboard URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads dynamically fetching data from backend APIs, displaying up-to-date financial, inventory, and patient metrics.

requirement_tested: A backend application connecting to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A system developer named Alex responsible for ensuring backend services are properly connected.
user_goal: To confirm that the backend service connects securely to the correct PostgreSQL database instance.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: Alex starts the backend server and wants to verify it establishes a successful connection to the PostgreSQL database.
narrative_steps.action: Run the backend server startup command.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend logs indicate a successful connection to the PostgreSQL database using the environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.

requirement_tested: Financial management module for collecting patient fees and managing hospital finances
user_persona: A billing clerk named Mia who handles patient payments and tracks hospital income.
user_goal: To record a new patient payment and ensure it reflects correctly in the financial records.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Fee Collection Form
narrative_steps.description: Mia goes to the financial section and looks for the option to enter a new patient fee.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Collect Patient Fees' button in the Financial Management dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A form appears where she can input patient ID, amount, transaction type, and description.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Payment Information
narrative_steps.description: After filling out the necessary fields, Mia submits the form to record the payment.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button after entering valid data.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system saves the transaction and displays a confirmation message. The updated transaction history now includes the new entry.

requirement_tested: Reporting module generating inventory reports, patient reports, and financial reports
user_persona: A department head named James who prepares weekly reports for senior management.
user_goal: To generate and export an inventory report showing current stock levels.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Reports Section
narrative_steps.description: James accesses the reporting dashboard to find options for different types of reports.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Reports' link in the main navigation menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Three tabs appear: Inventory, Patient, and Financial Reports.

narrative_steps.title: Generating Inventory Report
narrative_steps.description: He selects the Inventory tab and clicks the generate button to produce a report.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Generate Inventory Report' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An inventory report is displayed with current item counts and low-stock warnings.

narrative_steps.title: Exporting the Report
narrative_steps.description: James decides to share this report by exporting it as a CSV file.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Export as CSV' button next to the report.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A downloadable CSV file containing the inventory report data is generated and ready for download.

requirement_tested: Daily report submission feature for employees to provide detailed activity information to superiors
user_persona: A nurse named Linda who must submit her daily work summary to her supervisor.
user_goal: To submit her daily activities report and confirm it reaches her supervisor.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Daily Report Form
narrative_steps.description: Linda navigates to the daily reporting section to fill in today’s tasks.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Submit Daily Report' button in her personal dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A form opens with fields for date selection and a large text area for activity details.

narrative_steps.title: Filling and Submitting Report
narrative_steps.description: She fills in her duties and submits the report for review.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in the activity details and click the 'Submit' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system confirms submission and marks the report status as pending approval in the supervisor’s view.

requirement_tested: Pharmacy management module for medicine inventory tracking
user_persona: A pharmacist named Tom who manages medicine stocks in the hospital pharmacy.
user_goal: To update the quantity of a particular medicine after receiving a new shipment.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Medicine Inventory
narrative_steps.description: Tom checks the current inventory list to locate the medicine needing restocking.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the Pharmacy Management section and view the medicine list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A searchable table of medicines with names, quantities, and expiry dates is displayed.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Stock Quantity
narrative_steps.description: Tom finds the medicine and increases its quantity to reflect the new supply.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Edit' button beside the medicine row, change the quantity field, and click 'Update'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system updates the quantity in the database and refreshes the inventory table to show the new value.

requirement_tested: Patient electronic files storing name, date of visit, diagnosis, and comments
user_persona: A doctor named Dr. Lee who reviews patient history during consultations.
user_goal: To access and review a patient's past visits and diagnoses.

narrative_steps.title: Searching for Patient File
narrative_steps.description: Dr. Lee searches for a patient's file using their name to check previous visits.
narrative_steps.action: Go to the Patient Files section and enter the patient's name into the search bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A filtered list of matching patient files appears, including dates of visits and diagnoses.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Visit Details
narrative_steps.description: Dr. Lee clicks on a specific visit to see full details like diagnosis and comments.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a patient file from the search results.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A detailed view panel expands showing the patient's name, date of visit, diagnosis, and any additional comments made during that session.

requirement_tested: Claim formulation functionality for processing medical claims
user_persona: An insurance coordinator named Rachel who processes medical claims for reimbursement.
user_goal: To create and submit a new medical claim for a treated patient.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating New Claim
narrative_steps.description: Rachel begins creating a new claim for a recently treated patient.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'New Claim' button in the Claims Management section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A form opens requesting patient ID, treatment details, and claim amount.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Claim for Processing
narrative_steps.description: After filling in the required information, Rachel submits the claim.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Submit Claim' button after completing the form.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system saves the claim and sets its status to 'Pending', making it visible in the processing queue.

requirement_tested: Laboratory management system for handling lab operations
user_persona: A lab technician named Jordan who performs tests and logs results.
user_goal: To mark a test as completed and enter the results into the system.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Pending Test
narrative_steps.description: Jordan checks the lab dashboard for pending tests assigned to him.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the Laboratory Management section and filter by 'Pending' status.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A list of pending tests assigned to Jordan is displayed, along with relevant patient IDs and test types.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Results and Marking Completion
narrative_steps.description: Jordan completes a blood test and enters the result before marking it done.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the test, enter results in the provided form, then click 'Complete Test'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system updates the test status to 'Completed' and stores the entered results linked to the patient's record.

requirement_tested: Theater management module for operating room scheduling and tracking
user_persona: An OR scheduler named Emma who coordinates surgeries and assigns resources.
user_goal: To schedule a new surgery in an available operating theater.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Theater Availability
narrative_steps.description: Emma views the calendar to identify free time slots for scheduling a new surgery.
narrative_steps.action: Open the Theater Scheduling calendar view.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A weekly calendar shows booked and available times across multiple theaters.

narrative_steps.title: Booking Surgery Slot
narrative_steps.description: She schedules a new procedure by filling in the required details and saving the booking.
narrative_steps.action: Select an open slot, click 'Schedule Surgery', fill in surgeon, patient, and surgery type, then click 'Save'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The calendar now shows the newly scheduled surgery marked in Indian Red, preventing conflicts for other bookings.

requirement_tested: User authentication and role-based access control for different employee types
user_persona: A new receptionist named Olivia who has just been granted access to the system.
user_goal: To log in with her assigned role and gain access only to permitted sections.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Olivia visits the login page and attempts to sign in with her new credentials.
narrative_steps.action: Enter username and password, select 'Receptionist' role, and click 'Login'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: She is redirected to the Receptionist dashboard which limits access to only patient registration and appointment modules.

requirement_tested: Dashboard displaying key metrics across finance, inventory, and patient data
user_persona: A hospital director named Robert who monitors overall performance daily.
user_goal: To quickly assess hospital health through key performance indicators.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Main Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Robert logs in and immediately views the central dashboard for a snapshot of operations.
narrative_steps.action: Log in and land on the default dashboard screen.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Metric cards for total revenue, inventory alerts, and active patients are prominently displayed with visual indicators.

narrative_steps.title: Drilling Down into Metrics
narrative_steps.description: He clicks on a card to explore more detailed analytics behind the numbers.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Total Revenue' metric card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A detailed chart appears showing revenue trends over the last week, helping identify fluctuations.

requirement_tested: Data entry forms for patient information, inventory updates, and financial transactions
user_persona: A registrar named Grace who frequently inputs new patient registrations.
user_goal: To register a new patient accurately using the standardized data entry form.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Patient Entry Form
narrative_steps.description: Grace accesses the form used specifically for registering new patients.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Register New Patient' button in the Patients section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A multi-field form opens pre-configured with validation rules and mandatory fields highlighted.

narrative_steps.title: Saving Patient Record
narrative_steps.description: Grace fills in all required details and saves the new patient record.
narrative_steps.action: Complete all fields and click the 'Save' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system validates the data, saves the record, and returns a success notification. The new patient is now searchable in the system.

requirement_tested: Background color configured to peach puff with components using indian red
user_persona: A UI designer named Casey evaluating whether the website meets brand guidelines.
user_goal: To visually verify that the site follows the specified color scheme consistently.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Global Styling
narrative_steps.description: Casey inspects the base styles applied throughout the application.
narrative_steps.action: Load any page and inspect the body background style.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The background color is set to Peach Puff (#FFDAB9) globally across all pages.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Component Colors
narrative_steps.description: Casey examines interactive elements such as buttons and form headers.
narrative_steps.action: Check the color properties of primary buttons and section headers.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All primary interactive elements utilize Indian Red (#CD5C5C) as per design specifications.

requirement_tested: Concurrent development server setup for frontend and backend via npm scripts
user_persona: A developer named Ethan setting up a local development environment for the first time.
user_goal: To run both frontend and backend servers simultaneously using a single command.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Ethan ensures all project dependencies are installed locally.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend packages are installed concurrently without errors.

narrative_steps.title: Launching Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Ethan starts both development servers together for efficient coding.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run dev` in the terminal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend and backend servers start concurrently, with output indicating they're listening on their respective ports.
